oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copy print of lithograph of Camp Douglas, Ill.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a copy print of a lithograph showing the detailed layout of Camp Douglas, Ill. The print is based on an illustration by F. Munson originally published in 1896. Many of the Confederate prisoners captured at Fort Henry, Donelson, Island No. 10, and; Shiloh were sent here. The prison camp remained open until the end of the war. Over 26,000 Confederates soldiers passed through the camp of which over 4,000 are estimated to have died.
